intro: Gouania laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered gouania, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in inflorescences. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Gouania laxiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
